Każda mapa różni się od poprzedniej.Niektórym może nie przypaść do gustu gęsta i mroczna atmosfera gry, jednak jest ona ważną częścią tej produkcji. Polecam każdemu, komu brakuje gry science fiction z odrobina horroru. 9/10

un juegazo.
Receta de Berenjenas rellenas de carne al horno.
4 berenjenas
1 cebolla
2 dientes de ajo
1 pimiento rojo
300g de carne picada de cerdo
300g de carne picada de ternera
500g de tomate triturado
1 cucharadita de tomillo seco
1 cucharadita de romero seco
70g de harina
70g de mantequilla
1l de leche entera
1 cucharadita de nuez moscada
100g de queso rallado
sal y pimienta
aceite de oliva
1.- Cortamos la parte del tallo de la berenjena. Después la cortamos a lo largo, por la mitad y a cada mitad, le vamos a hacer unos cortes con un cuchillo. Sin llegar a la parte de la piel. Le hacemos unos cortes, primero a lo largo y luego a lo ancho, para obtener al final unos cortes «en forma de rejilla». Hecho esto, las ponemos en una bandeja de horno, regamos la parte de la carne con un pequeño chorrito de aceite (la berenjena lo absorberá enseguida) y lo metemos en el horno, previamente calentado a 180ºC. Dejamos aquí unos 20 minutos

2.- Pasado el tiempo, retiramos y esperamos que se templen un poco. Después, con una cuchara retiramos la pulpa, manteniendo la cáscara intacta. Al estar parcialmente horneada, se separará muy fácil.

3.- En una sartén grande, ponemos a calentar un chorrito de aceite de oliva a fuego suave. Una vez esté caliente, añadimos los dientes de ajo, la cebolla y el pimiento rojo bien picados. Salpimentamos y dejamos cocinar unos 15 minutos, mientras removemos con frecuencia
4.- Pasados los 15 minutos, añadimos la carne de la berenjena, previamente picada. Incorporamos con el resto de la verdura y añadimos la carne picada de cerdo y de ternera. Con la ayuda de una cuchara de madera, vamos desmenuzando la carne, para que no queden mazacotes muy grandes y para ir integrándola con el resto de ingredientes. Cocinamos dos o tres minutos, hasta que pierda el color a crudo

5.- Ahora añadimos el tomate triturado y las cucharaditas de tomillo y romero. Personalmente la combinación de estas dos especias me encanta pero, puedes sustituirlas por una cucharada de orégano. Mezclamos e integramos todos los ingredientes y después, dejamos cocer todo a fuego suave unos 30 minutos. Hasta que se evaporen todo el agua que ha soltado la carne picada y el tomate

6.- Mientras se evapora, preparamos la salsa bechamel. En otra olla alta, ponemos a calentar la mantequilla (puedes sustituirla por aceite de oliva) y una vez se haya derretido, añadimos la harina.  Mezclamos y tostamos unos 3 minutos. Esta mezcla, recibe el nombre de «roux». Pasado el tiempo, vamos añadiendo poco a poco la leche. Añadimos unos 200ml y mezclamos, hasta que se integre con la roux. Hecho esto, volvemos a añadir otros 200ml y volvemos a integrar. Repetimos este paso hasta acabar con toda la leche -y lograr una salsa bechamel ligera-. Es entonces cuando añadimos una cucharadita de nuez moscada y reservamos.
7.- Con todo esto hecho, tan sólo queda rellenar las berenjenas. Cogemos las cáscaras y las rellenamos con generosa cantidad del relleno que habíamos preparado. Puedes añadir a cada cáscara la cantidad de relleno que quieras. Lo importante es acabar con todo. Hecho esto, regamos cada berenjena rellena con salsa bechamel. Finalmente espolvoreamos con queso y rallado y las introducimos de nuevo en el horno, función grill a 200ºC. Las dejamos aquí unos 10 minutos, hasta que el queso se gratine

I love this game. Amazing gameplay, Good lore, and I'm too scared to play the episodes because I know it leaves with a cliffhanger. So thats why I'm ending half life in this game. Half life 2 has been my childhood without me even knowing it. I was a big Garry's Mod fan when I was younger and experiencing this masterpiece of a game again but with a storyline and lore is AMAZING to say the least. A must buy if you have not played before, well worth its money. Now, stop looking at the reviews and go buy it.
A legendary game that defined the development of the genre. Thank you for it.

Overall Review: 6/10, feels like a watered down Halo.

First of all, I would like to stress that I have not beaten Half Life 2 or its episodes, nor have I even played Half Life 1 and its expansions, Blue Shift, Opposing Force, or Decay. Due to this, I recommend taking this review with a HANDFUL of salt, as this is based upon my incomplete experience.

Pros:
- Gunplay is relatively solid, especially coming from a 2004 shooter.
- Graphical fidelity is impressive, given the game's age.
- AI is brilliant, the Combine will actually use tactics and try to flush you out of areas and use pincer attacks and even utilize the environment to their advantage, rather than spamming hundreds of enemies at you all at once, like Destiny or even Halo to an extent.
- Each combat encounter can be dealt with differently, and my way of beating a boss and your way of beating a boss might be totally different.
- Voice acting is solid, conveys emotion and character well.
- G Man is enigmatic and interesting, although nothing has really been done with him.
- Weapons are fun to use, especially the creativity that can come from the Gravity Gun and the Combine Pulse Rifle ball...energy...bouncy...thing.
- Very long for a shooter, 15 hours in and I never beat it.
- Barney.

Cons:
- No aim assist (I grew up with console games and still regularly use a controller.)
- Reticle is incredibly small, and the orange tint of the HUD is often hard to discern against similarly coloured backgrounds.
- Game can get incredibly boring, there's rarely if ever, any music, and even big moments feel bland and uninteresting.
- Game is incredibly long, and even though I listed that as a pro, it is also a bit of a con, especially given that there's no real indication as to where you are in the story. At least in Halo, you had an idea where you were story wise, you knew you were nearing the end when when you had to assault the Control Room or stop the Prophets from activating the Halo array. 
- The game feels very lifeless, which I suppose makes sense if you know the story, but it's a city dammit, I expect at least some people.
- The Combine feel very faceless as an antagonist. Sure the design for their soldiers is recognizable, but as an actual entity? Not really. The only thing that "defines" the Combine is the Citadel, and that's far less memorable than a Covenant Capital Ship or a Star Destroyer.
- The game gives you little to no indication where to go whatsoever. If this was an old RPG, I'd be more forgiving, but with this being a shooter, one that's supposed to be linear, i shouldn't have to spend 15 minutes trying to find a way to go, only to realize that I'm supposed to travel down a dank, unassuming sewer to get to the next area.
- The game is hard as balls. Maybe I'm just not good at it, but one of my reasons for never finishing it was because of how difficult the game is. For example, at multiple points the game gives you rockets to take down an enemy type that can ONLY be defeated with rockets, and it takes three to take said enemy down. How many does HL2 give you? Three. You get three rockets. Which means that if you miss even once, you now have to either reload a checkpoint, die and load back, or pray to almighty Gabe Newell that you can find one extra rocket in some hidden area that is the exact opposite of obvious. This alone caused me to restart sections several times JUST to kill one or two enemies that can and will mess you up regardless of what you do, and are entirely unskippable. I get that this is an old game and old games are tough, but again, Halo 2 while being incredibly difficult, gave you the necessary tools to beat the level, and made sure you had stuff to spare, even on higher difficulties.

All in all, if you want space marine shooty game, go play Halo 2. Or Halo CE. Or Halo 3. You will more than likely enjoy that more than you'd enjoy this. Now if unforgiving combat, a boring story, a bland world, and a game that will never be finished sounds fun to you, then you'll love Half Life 2.

[h1][Español][/h1]
Sin lugar a dudas uno de los juegos más iconicos de todos los tiempos.

De los primeros juegos que jugué de pequeño que marcó mucho de mi infancia y que me hizo sentir cosas que ningun otro había logrado antes, después de años de no jugarlo (13 años) vuelvo a instalarlo y sentir un escalofrio y nostalgia preciosos que no generan nada mas que felicidad.

Su jugabilidad es, aunque ya un poco vieja para la epoca sigue siendo super comoda y organica, nunca vas a sentirte lento jugando y mucho menos vas a confundirte al jugar.

El más grandioso mérito de Half-Life 2, y aquella característica que distingue a la saga, es la utilización del lenguaje del videojuego en su más fidedigna expresión para un desenvolvimiento de la narrativa más inmersivo. Esto se traduce en que los hechos siempre se desencadenan frente al usuario y en tiempo real; nunca mediante cinemáticas o por alguna otra vía que interrumpa la experiencia jugable.

Así como en el aspecto que al argumento se refiere Half-Life 2 ha logrado la difícil tarea de superar de todas las formas posibles a su antecesor, también lo consigue en cada uno de los elementos que componen a la jugabilidad sin abandonar ni por un segundo la esencia de la franquicia.

10/10

[h1][English][/h1]
Without a doubt one of the most iconic games of all time.

Of the first games that I played as a child that marked a lot of my childhood and that made me feel things that no one else had achieved before, after years of not playing it (13 years) I reinstall it and feel a precious chill and nostalgia that does not generate nothing but happiness.

Its playability is, although already a little old for the time it is still super comfortable and organic, you will never feel slow playing and much less will you get confused when playing.

The greatest merit of Half-Life 2, and that characteristic that distinguishes the saga, is the use of the language of the video game in its truest expression for a more immersive development of the narrative. This means that events are always triggered in front of the user and in real time; never through cinematics or any other way that interrupts the playable experience.

Just as in the aspect that refers to the argument Half-Life 2 has achieved the difficult task of surpassing its predecessor in all possible ways, it also achieves it in each of the elements that make up the gameplay without abandoning for a second the essence of the franchise.

10/10
this game was fun at some points but the middle game was'n really fun because i din't know where and it was really complecatet but still it is an good game

I remember hearing Dr.Breen enlightening the human combine soldiers that a humble MIT graduate physicist shouldn't be able to break through their greatest defense lines, and I thought "well, he's Gordon Freeman, so it just works". But it wasn't until I finished the entire game that I first realized how ingenious the story design of HL2 was, and why this logic works: Gordon was not fighting alone, he has the human forces, he has the science team (though only Issac kleiner and Eli Vance), and he even receive helps from his enemies. Most the weapons that the combine used on Gordon were eventually used against themselves; those who were just trying to torn Gordon apart a minute ago might fought alongside him like his greatest allies (the only downside is they cannot speak human language). Combine failed because they underestimated the power of Gordon, or even to say, the entire human race. This kinda reminds me of that popular meme, quote, "Well well, how the turnables!"
